summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing the inadvertent public release of U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) records related to the Epstein investigation via a FOIA request. The email notes the Associate General Counsel at the USMS provided the original source materials (USM-11 forms) to ensure investigative accuracy and offered to serve as a point of contact.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division
persons.role: Chief, Criminal Division, United States Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: The recipient of the email, identified by their title at the end of the message. They are a senior official in the SDNY's Criminal Division overseeing the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Associate General Counsel at the USMS
persons.role: Associate General Counsel, U.S. Marshals Service
persons.context: A U.S. Marshals Service attorney who proactively contacted the SDNY to provide original investigative materials (USM-11 forms) that were inadvertently released, to ensure accuracy and offer assistance.

connections.person1: Associate General Counsel at the USMS
connections.description: The USMS attorney is providing investigative materials and offering to serve as a point of contact to the SDNY's Criminal Division Chief regarding the inadvertent release of records.

events.title: Press coverage of released USMS records
events.description: Press coverage begins regarding the release of U.S. Marshals Service records related to the Epstein investigation pursuant to a FOIA request.

events.title: USMS provides original materials to SDNY
events.description: The Associate General Counsel of the U.S. Marshals Service contacts the SDNY to provide the original source materials (USM-11 forms) that were inadvertently released, noting that press reports were not entirely accurate.
personsInvolved: Associate General Counsel at the USMS

keyFacts: U.S. Marshals Service records related to the Epstein investigation were inadvertently released to the public pursuant to a FOIA request.
The released records included USM-11 forms, which are described as equivalent to FBI 302 interview reports.
Press coverage of the released records began on or about September 12, 2019, and was noted to be inaccurate in some circumstances.
The Associate General Counsel of the USMS proactively provided the original source materials to the SDNY to ensure investigative accuracy and mitigate any potential harm to the investigation.
The email indicates internal coordination and concern within the SDNY about the impact of the document release on their ongoing investigation.
